keyTakeAways: US President Donald Trump has threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombia, accusing President Gustavo Petro of encouraging illegal drug production.
Colombian President Gustavo Petro responded by calling Trump 'rude and ignorant', and previously criticized US actions on drug trafficking and migration.

The US is Colombia’s largest trading partner, accounting for 30% of Colombian exports, including key products like coffee, flowers, gold, and fruits; new tariffs could lead to job losses and business bankruptcies.
Trump has threatened to cut off $450 million annually in US aid for drug eradication efforts in Colombia, impacting critical programs like coca and opium poppy eradication.
Colombians express widespread anxiety, fearing economic and personal consequences such as job losses, business closures, and difficulties renewing visas for family members in the US.

Colombians perceive both leaders as being out of touch with the realities of drug trafficking and national challenges, with public figures like taxi driver Ángel Duarte and housewife Sofia Anaya expressing concern over economic and personal impacts.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A diplomatic feud between US President Donald Trump and Colombian President Gustavo Petro has sparked widespread anxiety among Colombians, as Trump threatens to cut US aid and raise tariffs on Colombia, accusing Petro of promoting illegal drug production. Petro counters with accusations of rudeness and ignorance, and the conflict has deepened public fear about economic consequences, including job losses and business failures due to trade disruptions. The US is Colombia’s largest trading partner, accounting for 30% of exports, and the threat of losing $450 million annually in anti-drug aid raises serious concerns for both national security and economic stability. Citizens from various backgrounds express frustration, highlighting personal and societal impacts, and question both leaders’ judgment and respect for national realities.
title: Colombians caught in fallout of Trump-Petro feud
